18277.text: /and justice will produce/_lasting peace and security.

18278.text: ¶You, the Lord’s people,/will live in peace,/_calm and secure,

18280.text: /You will have God’s blessing,/as you plant your crops/_beside streams,/while your donkeys and cattle/_roam freely about.

18281.text: §¶You defeated my people.¶▼Now you’re in for trouble!/You’ve never been destroyed,/_but you will be destroyed;/you’ve never been betrayed,/_but you will be betrayed./When you have finished/_destroying and betraying,/you will be destroyed/_and betrayed in return.

18282.text: ¶Please, Lord, be kind to us!/_We depend on you./Make us strong each morning,/and come to save us/_when we are in trouble.

18283.text: /Nations scatter when you roar/_and show your greatness.

18284.text: /We attack our enemies/_like swarms of locusts;/we take everything/_that belongs to them.

18285.text: ¶You, Lord, are above all others,/_and you live in the heavens./You have brought justice/_and fairness to Jerusalem;

18286.text: /you are the foundation/_on which we stand today./You always save us and give/_true wisdom and knowledge./Nothing means more to us/_than obeying you.

18287.text: §¶Listen! Our bravest soldiers/are running through the streets,/_screaming for help./Our messengers hoped for peace,/_but came home crying.

18288.text: /No one travels anymore;/_every road is empty./Treaties are broken,/and no respect is shown/_to any who keep promises.

18289.text: /Fields are dry and barren;/Mount Lebanon wilts/_with shame./Sharon Valley is a desert;/the forests of Bashan and Carmel/_have lost their leaves.

18290.text: ¶But the Lord says,/“Now I will do something/_and be greatly praised.

18291.text: /Your deeds are straw/that will be set on fire/_by your very own breath.

18292.text: /You will be burned to ashes/_like thorns in a fire.

18293.text: /Everyone, both far and near,/come look at what I have done./_See my mighty power!”

18294.text: §¶Those terrible sinners/on Mount Zion tremble/_as they ask in fear,/“How can we possibly live/where a raging fire/_never stops burning?”

18295.text: ¶But there will be rewards/for those who live right/_and tell the truth,/for those who refuse/_to take money by force/_or accept bribes,/for all who hate murder/_and violent crimes.

18296.text: /They will live in a fortress/_high on a rocky cliff,/where they will have food/_and plenty of water.

18297.text: §¶With your own eyes/you will see the glorious King;/_you will see his kingdom/_reaching far and wide.

18298.text: /Then you will ask yourself,/_“Where are those officials/who terrified us and forced us/_to pay such heavy taxes?”

18299.text: /You will never again have to see/_the proud people who spoke/a strange and foreign language/_you could not understand.

18300.text: ¶Look to Mount Zion/where we celebrate/_our religious festivals./You will see Jerusalem,/_secure as a tent with pegs/that cannot be pulled up/and fastened with ropes/_that can never be broken.

18301.text: /Our wonderful Lord/_will be with us!/There will be deep rivers/and wide streams/_safe from enemy ships.

18302.text: §¶The Lord is our judge/_and our ruler;/the Lord is our king/_and will keep us safe.

18303.text: /But your nation is a ship/_with its rigging loose,/its mast shaky,/_and its sail not spread.¶Someday even you that are lame/will take everything you want/_from your enemies.

18304.text: /The Lord will forgive your sins,/and none of you will say,/_“I feel sick.”

18305.text: §¶Everyone of every nation,/_the entire earth,/and all of its creatures,/_come here and listen!

18306.text: /The Lord is terribly angry/_with the nations;/he has condemned them/_to be slaughtered.

18307.text: /Their dead bodies will be left/_to rot and stink;/their blood will flow/_down the mountains.

18308.text: /Each star will disappear—/the sky will roll up/_like a scroll./Everything in the sky/_will dry up and wilt/like leaves on a vine/_or fruit on a tree.

18309.text: §¶After the sword of the Lord/has done what it wants/_to the skies above,/it will come down on Edom,/the nation that the Lord/_has doomed for destruction.

18310.text: ¶The sword of the Lord/is covered with blood/_from lambs and goats,/together with fat/_from kidneys of rams./This is because the Lord/_will slaughter many people/and make a sacrifice of them/_in the city of Bozrah/and everywhere else/_in Edom.

18311.text: /Edom’s leaders are wild oxen./They are powerful bulls,/_but they will die/_with the others./Their country will be soaked/_with their blood,/and its soil made fertile/_with their fat.

18312.text: ¶The Lord has chosen/_the year and the day,/when he will take revenge/_and come to Zion’s defense.

18313.text: /Edom’s streams will turn into tar/_and its soil into sulfur—/then the whole country/_will go up in flames.

18314.text: /It will burn night and day/_and never stop smoking./Edom will be a desert,/_generation after generation;/no one will ever travel/_through that land.

18315.text: /Owls, hawks, and wild animals/_will make it their home./God will leave it in ruins,/_merely a pile of rocks.

18316.text: §¶Edom will be called/_“Kingdom of Nothing.”/Its rulers will also be nothing.

18317.text: /Its palaces and fortresses/_will be covered with thorns;/only wolves and ostriches/_will make their home there.

18318.text: /Wildcats and hyenas/_will hunt together,/demons will scream to demons,/and creatures of the night/_will live among the ruins.

18319.text: /Owls will nest there/to raise their young/_among its shadows,/while families of buzzards/_circle around.

18320.text: ¶In The Book of the Lord/you can search/and find/_where it is written,/“The Lord brought together/_all of his creatures/by the power of his Spirit./_Not one is missing.”

18321.text: /The Lord has decided/_where they each should live;/they will be there forever,/_generation after generation.

18322.text: §¶Thirsty deserts will be glad;/barren lands will celebrate/_and blossom with flowers.

18323.text: /Deserts will bloom everywhere/_and sing joyful songs./They will be as majestic/_as Mount Lebanon,/as glorious as Mount Carmel/_or Sharon Valley./Everyone will see/the wonderful splendor/_of the Lord our God.

18324.text: §¶Here is a message for all/who are weak,/trembling,/_and worried:

18325.text: /“Cheer up! Don’t be afraid./Your God is coming/_to punish your enemies./God will take revenge on them/_and rescue you.”

18326.text: ¶The blind will see,/and the ears of the deaf/_will be healed.

18327.text: /Those who were lame/_will leap around like deer;/tongues once silent/_will begin to shout./Water will rush/_through the desert.

18328.text: /Scorching sand/_will turn into a lake,/and thirsty ground/_will flow with fountains./Grass will grow in wetlands,/where packs of wild dogs/_once made their home.

18329.text: §¶A good road will be there,/and it will be named/_“God’s Sacred Highway.”/It will be for God’s people;/no one unfit to worship God/_will walk on that road./And no fools can travel/_on that highway.

18330.text: /No lions or other wild animals/_will come near that road;/only those the Lord has saved/_will travel there.

18331.text: ¶The people the Lord has rescued/will come back singing/_as they enter Zion./Happiness will be a crown/_they will always wear./They will celebrate and shout/because all sorrows/and worries/_will be gone far away.

18332.text: §¶Hezekiah had been king of Judah for fourteen years when King Sennacherib of Assyria invaded the country and captured every walled city

18333.text: except Jerusalem. The Assyrian king ordered his army commander to leave the city of Lachish and to take a large army to Jerusalem.¶The commander went there and stood on the road near the cloth makers’ shops along the canal from the upper pool.

18334.text: Three of the king’s highest officials came out of Jerusalem to meet him. One of them was Hilkiah’s son Eliakim, who was the prime minister. The other two were Shebna, assistant to the prime minister, and Joah son of Asaph, keeper of the government records.

18335.text: ¶The Assyrian commander told them:¶I have a message for Hezekiah from the great king of Assyria. Ask Hezekiah why he feels so sure of himself.

18336.text: Does he think he can plan and win a war with nothing but words? Who is going to help him, now that he has turned against the king of Assyria?

18337.text: Is he depending on Egypt and its king? That’s the same as leaning on a broken stick, and it will go right through his hand.

18338.text: ¶Is Hezekiah now depending on the Lord, your God? Didn’t Hezekiah tear down all except one of the Lord’s altars and places of worship? Didn’t he tell the people of Jerusalem and Judah to worship at that one place?

18339.text: ¶The king of Assyria wants to make a bet with you people! He will give you two thousand horses, if you have enough troops to ride them.

18340.text: How could you even defeat our lowest ranking officer, when you have to depend on Egypt for chariots and cavalry?

18341.text: Don’t forget that it was the Lord who sent me here with orders to destroy your nation!

18342.text: ¶Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said, “Sir, we don’t want the people listening from the city wall to understand what you are saying. So please speak to us in Aramaic instead of Hebrew.”

18343.text: ¶The Assyrian army commander answered, “My king sent me to speak to everyone, not just to you leaders. These people will soon have to eat their own body waste and drink their own urine! And so will the three of you!”

18344.text: ¶Then, in a voice loud enough for everyone to hear, he shouted out in Hebrew:¶Listen to what the great king of Assyria says!

18345.text: Don’t be fooled by Hezekiah. He can’t save you.

18346.text: Don’t trust him when he tells you that the Lord will protect you from the king of Assyria.

18347.text: Stop listening to Hezekiah. Pay attention to my king. Surrender to him. He will let you keep your own vineyards, fig trees, and cisterns

18348.text: for a while. Then he will come and take you away to a country just like yours, where you can plant vineyards and raise your own grain.

18349.text: ¶Hezekiah claims the Lord will save you. But don’t be fooled by him. Were any other gods able to defend their land against the king of Assyria?

18350.text: What happened to the gods of Hamath, Arpad, and Sepharvaim? Were the gods of Samaria able to protect their land against the Assyrian forces?

18351.text: None of these gods kept their people safe from the king of Assyria. Do you think the Lord, your God, can do any better?

18352.text: ¶Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah had been warned by King Hezekiah not to answer the Assyrian commander. So they tore their clothes in sorrow and reported to Hezekiah everything the commander had said.

18354.text: §¶As soon as Hezekiah heard the news, he tore off his clothes in sorrow and put on sackcloth. Then he went into the temple of the Lord.

18355.text: He told Prime Minister Eliakim, Assistant Prime Minister Shebna, and the senior priests to dress in sackcloth and tell me:

18356.text: ¶Isaiah, these are difficult and disgraceful times. Our nation is like a woman too weak to give birth, when it’s time for her baby to be born.

18357.text: Please pray for those of us who are left alive. The king of Assyria sent his army commander to insult the living God. Perhaps the Lord heard what he said and will do something, if you will pray.

18359.text: I told them that the Lord had this message for Hezekiah:¶I am the Lord. Don’t worry about the insulting things that have been said about me by these messengers from the king of Assyria.

18360.text: I will upset him with rumors about what’s happening in his own country. He will go back, and there I will make him die a violent death.

18361.text: ¶Meanwhile the commander of the Assyrian forces heard that his king had left the town of Lachish and was now attacking Libnah. So he went there.

18362.text: ¶About this same time, the king of Assyria learned that King Tirhakah of Ethiopia was on his way to attack him. Then the king of Assyria sent some messengers with this note for Hezekiah:

18363.text: ¶Don’t trust your God or be fooled by his promise to defend Jerusalem against me.

18364.text: You have heard how we Assyrian kings have completely wiped out other nations. What makes you feel so safe?

18365.text: The Assyrian kings before me destroyed the towns of Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and everyone from Eden who lived in Telassar. What good did their gods do them?

18366.text: The kings of Hamath, Arpad, Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah have all disappeared.

18367.text: §¶After Hezekiah had read the note from the king of Assyria, he took it to the temple and spread it out for the Lord to see.

18369.text: ¶Lord God All‐Powerful of Israel, your throne is above the winged creatures. You created the heavens and the earth, and you alone rule the kingdoms of this world.

18370.text: Just look and see how Sennacherib has insulted you, the living God.

18371.text: ¶It is true, our Lord, that Assyrian kings have turned nations into deserts.

18372.text: They destroyed the idols of wood and stone that the people of those nations had made and worshiped.

18373.text: But you are our Lord and our God! We ask you to keep us safe from the Assyrian king. Then everyone in every kingdom on earth will know that you are the only Lord.

18374.text: §¶I went to Hezekiah and told him that the Lord God of Israel had said:¶Hezekiah, you prayed to me about King Sennacherib of Assyria. Now this is what I say to that king:¶▼The people of Jerusalem/_hate and make fun of you;/_they laugh behind your back.

18376.text: ¶Sennacherib, you cursed,/shouted, and sneered at me,/_the holy God of Israel.

18377.text: /You let your officials/_insult me, the Lord./And here is what you/_have said about yourself,/“I led my chariots/_to the highest heights/_of Lebanon’s mountains./I went deep into its forest,/cutting down the best cedar/_and cypress trees.

18378.text: /I dried up every stream/_in the land of Egypt,/and I drank water/_from wells I had dug.”

18379.text: ¶Sennacherib, now listen/_to me, the Lord./I planned all of this long ago./And you don’t even know/_that I alone am the one/who decided that you/_would do these things./I let you make ruins/_of fortified cities.

18380.text: /Their people became weak,/_terribly confused./They were like wild flowers/or like tender young grass/_growing on a flat roof/or like a field of grain/_before it matures.

18381.text: ¶I know all about you,/_even how fiercely angry/_you are with me.

18382.text: /I have seen your pride/_and the tremendous hatred/_you have for me./Now I will put a hook/_in your nose,/_a bit in your mouth,/then I will send you back/_to where you came from.

18383.text: ¶Hezekiah, I will tell you what’s going to happen. This year you will eat crops that grow on their own, and the next year you will eat whatever springs up where those crops grew. But the third year, you will plant grain and vineyards, and you will eat what you harvest.

18384.text: Those who survive in Judah will be like a vine that puts down deep roots and bears fruit.

18385.text: I, the Lord All‐Powerful, will see to it that some who live in Jerusalem will survive.

18386.text: ¶I promise that the king of Assyria won’t get into Jerusalem, or shoot an arrow into the city, or even surround it and prepare to attack.

18387.text: As surely as I am the Lord, he will return by the way he came and will never enter Jerusalem.

18388.text: I will protect it for the sake of my own honor and because of the promise I made to my servant David.

18389.text: §¶The Lord sent an angel to the camp of the Assyrians, and he killed one hundred eighty‐five thousand of them all in one night. The next morning, the camp was full of dead bodies.

18390.text: After this, King Sennacherib went back to Assyria and lived in the city of Nineveh.

18391.text: One day he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, when his sons, Adrammelech and Sharezer, killed him with their swords. They escaped to the land of Ararat, and his son Esarhaddon became king.

18392.text: §¶About this time, Hezekiah got sick and was almost dead. So I went in and told him, “The Lord says you won’t ever get well. You are going to die, and so you had better start doing what needs to be done.”

18393.text: ¶Hezekiah turned toward the wall and prayed,

18394.text: “Don’t forget that I have been faithful to you, Lord. I have obeyed you with all my heart, and I do whatever you say is right.” After this, he cried hard.

18396.text: with this message for Hezekiah:¶I am the Lord God, who was worshiped by your ancestor David. I heard you pray, and I saw you cry. I will let you live fifteen years more,

18397.text: while I protect you and your city from the king of Assyria.

18398.text: ¶Now I will prove to you that I will keep my promise.

18399.text: Do you see the shadow made by the setting sun on the stairway built for King Ahaz? I will make the shadow go back ten steps.¶Then the shadow went back ten steps.

18400.text: §¶This is what Hezekiah wrote after he got well:

18401.text: ¶I thought I would die/_during my best years/and stay as a prisoner forever/_in the world of the dead.

18402.text: /I thought I would never again/_see you, my Lord,/or any of the people/_who live on this earth.

18403.text: /My life was taken from me/like the tent that a shepherd/_pulls up and moves./You cut me off like thread/_from a weaver’s loom;/you make a wreck of me/_day and night.

18404.text: ¶Until morning came, I thought/you would crush my bones/_just like a hungry lion;/both night and day/_you make a wreck of me.

18405.text: /I cry like a swallow;/_I mourn like a dove./My eyes are red/_from looking to you, Lord./I am terribly abused./_Please come and help me.

18406.text: /There’s nothing I can say/_in answer to you,/since you are the one/_who has done this to me./My life has turned sour;/_I will limp until I die.

18407.text: ¶Your words and your deeds/bring life to everyone,/_including me./Please make me healthy/_and strong again.

18408.text: /It was for my own good/_that I had such hard times./But your love protected me/_from doom in the deep pit,/and you turned your eyes/_away from my sins.

18409.text: ¶No one in the world of the dead/_can thank you/or praise you;/none of those in the deep pit/can hope for you/to show them/_how faithful you are.

18410.text: /Only the living can thank you,/_as I am doing today./Each generation tells the next/_about your faithfulness.

18411.text: ¶You, Lord, will save me,/_and every day that we live/we will sing in your temple/to the music/_of stringed instruments.

18412.text: §¶I had told King Hezekiah’s servants to put some mashed figs on the king’s open sore, and he would get well.

18413.text: Then Hezekiah asked for proof that he would again worship in the Lord’s temple.

18414.text: §¶Merodach Baladan, the son of Baladan, was now king of Babylonia. And when he learned that Hezekiah was well, he sent messengers with letters and a gift for him.

18415.text: Hezekiah welcomed the messengers and showed them all the silver, the gold, the spices, and the fine oils that were in his storehouse. He even showed them where he kept his weapons. Nothing in his palace or in his entire kingdom was kept hidden from them.

18416.text: ¶I asked Hezekiah, “Where did these men come from? What did they want?”¶“They came all the way from Babylonia,” Hezekiah answered.

18417.text: ¶“What did you show them?” I asked.¶Hezekiah answered, “I showed them everything in my kingdom.”

18418.text: ¶Then I told Hezekiah:¶I have a message for you from the Lord All‐Powerful.

18419.text: One day everything you and your ancestors have stored up will be taken to Babylonia. The Lord has promised that nothing will be left.

18420.text: Some of your own sons will be taken to Babylonia, where they will be disgraced and made to serve in the king’s palace.

18421.text: ¶Hezekiah thought, “At least our nation will be at peace for a while.” So he told me, “The message you brought from the Lord is good.”

18422.text: §¶Our God has said:¶▼“Encourage my people!/_Give them comfort.

18423.text: /Speak kindly to Jerusalem/_and announce:/Your slavery is past;/_your punishment is over./I, the Lord, made you pay/_double for your sins.”

18424.text: ¶Someone is shouting:/“Clear a path in the desert!/_Make a straight road/_for the Lord our God.

18425.text: /Fill in the valleys;/flatten every hill/_and mountain./Level the rough/_and rugged ground.

18426.text: /Then the glory of the Lord/_will appear for all to see./The Lord has promised this!”

18427.text: ¶Someone told me to shout,/and I asked,/_“What should I shout?”/We humans are merely grass,/and we last no longer/_than wild flowers.

18428.text: /At the Lord’s command,/flowers and grass disappear,/_and so do we.

18429.text: /Flowers and grass fade away,/but what our God has said/_will never change.

18430.text: §¶There is good news/_for the city of Zion./Shout it as loud as you can/_from the highest mountain./Don’t be afraid to shout/to the towns of Judah,/_“Your God is here!”

18431.text: /Look! The powerful Lord God/is coming/to rule/_with his mighty arm./He brings with him/what he has taken in war,/_and he rewards his people.

18432.text: /The Lord cares for his nation,/just as shepherds care/_for their flocks./He carries the lambs/_in his arms,/while gently leading/_the mother sheep.

18433.text: §¶Did any of you measure/_the ocean by yourself/or stretch out the sky/_with your own hands?/Did you put the soil/_of the earth in a bucket/or weigh the hills and mountains/_on balance scales?

18434.text: ¶Has anyone told the Lord/what he must do/_or given him advice?

18435.text: /Did the Lord ask anyone/to teach him wisdom/_and justice?/Who gave him knowledge/_and understanding?

18436.text: /To the Lord, all nations/are merely a drop in a bucket/_or dust on balance scales;/all of the islands/_are but a handful of sand.

18437.text: /The cattle/_on Lebanon’s mountains/would not be enough/to offer/_as a sacrifice to God,/and the trees would not/_be enough for the fire.

18438.text: /God thinks of the nations/_as far less than nothing.

18439.text: ¶Who compares with God?/_Is anything like him?

18440.text: /Is an idol at all like God?/_It is made of bronze/with a thin layer of gold,/_and decorated with silver.

18441.text: /Or special wood may be chosen/_because it doesn’t rot—/then skilled hands/take care to make an idol/_that won’t fall on its face.

18442.text: §¶Don’t you know?/_Haven’t you heard?/Isn’t it clear that God/_created the world?

18443.text: /God is the one who rules/_the whole earth,/and we that live here/_are merely insects./He spread out the heavens/like a curtain or an open tent.

18444.text: ¶God brings down rulers/_and turns them into nothing.

18445.text: /They are like flowers/freshly sprung up/_and starting to grow./But when God blows on them,/they wilt/and are carried off/_like straw in a storm.

18446.text: ¶The holy God asks,/“Who compares with me?/_Is anyone my equal?”

18447.text: ¶Look at the evening sky!/_Who created the stars?/Who gave them each a name?/_Who leads them like an army?/The Lord is so powerful/that none of the stars/_are ever missing.

18448.text: §¶You people of Israel, say,/“God pays no attention to us!/_He doesn’t care if we/_are treated unjustly.”¶But how can you say that?

18449.text: /Don’t you know?/_Haven’t you heard?/The Lord is the eternal God,/_Creator of the earth./He never gets weary or tired;/his wisdom cannot be measured.

18450.text: ¶The Lord gives strength/_to those who are weary.

18451.text: /Even young people get tired,/_then stumble and fall.

18452.text: /But those who trust the Lord/_will find new strength./They will be strong like eagles/_soaring upward on wings;/they will walk and run/_without getting tired.

18453.text: §¶Be silent and listen,/_every island in the sea./Have courage and come near,/_every one of you nations./Let’s settle this matter!

18454.text: /Who appointed this ruler/_from the east?/Who puts nations and kings/_in his power?/His sword and his arrows/turn them to dust/_blown by the wind.

18455.text: /He goes after them so quickly/that his feet/_barely touch the ground—/he doesn’t even get hurt.

18456.text: ¶Who makes these things happen?/Who controls human events?/_I do! I am the Lord./I was there at the beginning;/_I will be there at the end.

18457.text: /Islands and foreign nations/saw what I did/and trembled/_as they came near.

18459.text: /Woodcarvers, goldsmiths,/_and other workers/encourage one another and say,/_“We’ve done a great job!”/Then they nail the idol down,/_so it won’t fall over.

18460.text: §¶Israel, you are my servant./I chose you,/the family/_of my friend Abraham.

18461.text: /From far across the earth/_I brought you here and said,/“You are my chosen servant./_I haven’t forgotten you.”

18462.text: ¶Don’t be afraid. I am with you./Don’t tremble with fear./_I am your God./I will make you strong,/as I protect you with my arm/_and give you victories.

18463.text: /Everyone who hates you/_will be terribly disgraced;/those who attack/_will vanish into thin air.

18464.text: /You will look around/_for those brutal enemies,/but you won’t find them/_because they will be gone.

18465.text: ¶I am the Lord your God./I am holding your hand,/_so don’t be afraid./I am here to help you.

18466.text: ¶People of Israel, don’t worry,/though others may say,/_“Israel is only a worm!”/I am the holy God of Israel,/_who saves and protects you.

18467.text: /I will let you be like a log/_covered with sharp spikes./You will grind and crush/every mountain and hill/_until they turn to dust.

18468.text: /A strong wind will scatter them/_in all directions./Then you will celebrate/and praise me, your Lord,/_the holy God of Israel.

18469.text: §¶When the poor and needy/are dying of thirst/_and cannot find water,/I, the Lord God of Israel,/will come to their rescue./_I won’t forget them.

18470.text: /I will make rivers flow/_on mountain peaks./I will send streams/_to fill the valleys./Dry and barren land/will flow with springs/_and become a lake.

18471.text: /I will fill the desert/_with all kinds of trees—/cedars, acacias, and myrtles;/olive and cypress trees;/_fir trees and pines.

18472.text: /Everyone will see this/_and know that I,/the holy Lord God of Israel,/_created it all.

18473.text: §¶I am the Lord,/_the King of Israel!/Come argue your case with me./_Present your evidence.

18474.text: /Come near me, you idols./Tell us about the past,/_and we will think about it./Tell us about the future,/so we will know/_what is going to happen.

18475.text: /Prove that you are gods/by making your predictions/_come true./Do something good or evil,/so we can be amazed/_and terrified.

18476.text: /You idols are nothing,/_and you are powerless./To worship you/_would be disgusting.

18477.text: ¶I, the Lord, appointed a ruler/_in the north;/now he comes from the east/_to honor my name./He tramples kings like mud,/_as potters trample clay.

18478.text: /Did any of you idols predict/_what would happen?/Did any of you get it right?/None of you told about this/_or even spoke a word.

18479.text: /I was the first to tell/the people of Jerusalem,/_“Look, it’s happening!”/I was the one who announced/_this good news to Zion.

18480.text: ¶None of these idols/are able to give advice/_or answer questions.

18481.text: /They are nothing,/_and they can do nothing—/they are less/_than a passing breeze.

18482.text: §¶Here is my servant!¶▼I have made him strong./He is my chosen one;/_I am pleased with him./I have given him my Spirit,/and he will bring justice/_to the nations.

18483.text: /He won’t shout or yell/_or call out in the streets.

18484.text: /He won’t break off a bent reed/_or put out a dying flame,/but he will make sure/_that justice is done.

18485.text: /He won’t quit or give up/until he brings justice/_everywhere on earth,/and people in foreign nations/_long for his teaching.

18486.text: ¶I am the Lord God./I created the heavens/_like an open tent above./I made the earth and everything/_that grows on it./I am the source of life/for all who live on this earth,/_so listen to what I say.

18487.text: /I chose you to bring justice,/_and I am here at your side./I selected and sent you/_to bring light/and my promise of hope/_to the nations.

18488.text: /You will give sight/_to the blind;/you will set prisoners free/_from dark dungeons.

18489.text: ¶My name is the Lord!/I won’t let idols or humans/_share my glory and praise.

18490.text: /Everything has happened/_just as I said it would;/now I will announce/_what will happen next.

18491.text: §¶Tell the whole world to sing/_a new song to the Lord!/Tell those who sail the ocean/and those who live far away/_to join in the praise.

18492.text: /Tell the tribes of the desert/and everyone in the mountains/_to celebrate and sing.

18494.text: /The Lord is marching out/_like an angry soldier,/shouting with all his might/_while attacking his enemies.

18495.text: §¶For a long time, I, the Lord,/_have held my temper;/now I will scream and groan/_like a woman giving birth.

18496.text: /I will destroy the mountains/_and what grows on them;/I will dry up rivers and ponds.

18497.text: ¶I will lead the blind on roads/_they have never known;/I will guide them on paths/_they have never traveled./Their road is dark and rough,/_but I will give light/to keep them from stumbling./_This is my solemn promise.

18498.text: ¶Everyone who worships idols/as though they were gods/_will be terribly ashamed.

18499.text: §¶You people are deaf and blind,/but the Lord commands you/_to listen and to see.

18500.text: /No one is as blind or deaf/as his messenger,/_his chosen servant,

18501.text: /who sees and hears so much,/_but pays no attention.

18502.text: ¶The Lord always does right,/and so he wanted his Law/_to be greatly praised.

18503.text: /But his people were trapped/and imprisoned in holes/_with no one to rescue them./All they owned had been taken,/and no one was willing/_to give it back.

18504.text: /Why won’t his people/_ever learn to listen?

18505.text: ¶Israel sinned and refused/to obey the Lord/_or follow his instructions./So the Lord let them be robbed/_of everything they owned.

18506.text: /He was furious with them/and punished their nation/_with the fires of war./Still they paid no attention./_They didn’t even care/when they were surrounded/_and scorched by flames.

18507.text: §¶Descendants of Jacob,/I, the Lord, created you/_and formed your nation./Israel, don’t be afraid./_I have rescued you./I have called you by name;/_now you belong to me.

18508.text: /When you cross deep rivers,/I will be with you,/_and you won’t drown./When you walk through fire,/you won’t be burned/_or scorched by the flames.

18509.text: ¶I am the Lord, your God,/the Holy One of Israel,/_the God who saves you./I gave up Egypt, Ethiopia,/and the region of Seba/_in exchange for you.

18510.text: /To me, you are very dear,/_and I love you./That’s why I gave up nations/_and people to rescue you.

18511.text: ¶Don’t be afraid! I am with you./From both east and west/_I will bring you together.

18512.text: /I will say to the north/_and to the south,/“Free my sons and daughters!/Let them return/_from distant lands.

18513.text: /They are my people—/I created each of them/_to bring honor to me.”

18514.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼Bring my people together./They have eyes and ears,/_but they can’t see or hear.

18515.text: /Tell everyone of every nation/_to gather around./None of them can honestly say,/_“We told you so!”/If someone heard them say this,/_then tell us about it now.

18516.text: ¶My people, you are my witnesses/_and my chosen servant./I want you to know me,/to trust me,/and understand/_that I alone am God./I have always been God;/_there can be no others.

18517.text: ¶I alone am the Lord;/_only I can rescue you.

18518.text: /I promised to save you,/_and I kept my promise./You are my witnesses/that no other god did this./_I, the Lord, have spoken.

18519.text: /I am God now and forever./No one can snatch you from me/_or stand in my way.

18520.text: §¶I, the Lord, will rescue you!/I am Israel’s holy God,/_and this is my promise:/For your sake, I will send/_an army against Babylon/to drag its people away,/_crying as they go.

18521.text: ¶I am the Lord, your holy God,/_Israel’s Creator and King.

18522.text: /I am the one who cut a path/_through the mighty ocean.

18523.text: /I sent an army to chase you/_with chariots and horses;/now they lie dead,/_unable to move./They are like an oil lamp/_with the flame snuffed out.

18524.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼Forget what happened long ago!/_Don’t think about the past.

18525.text: /I am creating something new./_There it is! Do you see it?/I have put roads in deserts,/_streams in thirsty lands.

18526.text: /Every wild animal honors me,/_even jackals and owls./I provide water in deserts—/streams in thirsty lands/_for my chosen people.

18527.text: /I made them my own nation,/_so they would praise me.

18528.text: ¶I, the Lord, said to Israel:/You have become weary,/_but not from worshiping me.

18529.text: /You have not honored me/by sacrificing sheep/_or other animals./And I have not burdened you/with demands for sacrifices/_or sweet‐smelling incense.

18530.text: ¶You have not brought/_delicious spices for me/or given me the best part/_of your sacrificed animals./Instead, you burden me down/_with your terrible sins.

18531.text: /But I wipe away your sins/_because of who I am./And so, I will forget/_the wrongs you have done.

18532.text: ¶Meet me in court!/State your case/and prove/_that you are right.

18533.text: /Your earliest ancestor/and all of your leaders/_rebelled against me.

18534.text: /That’s why I don’t allow/_your priests to serve me;/I let Israel be destroyed/_and your people disgraced.

18535.text: §¶People of Israel,/I have chosen you/_as my servant.

18536.text: /I am your Creator./You were in my care/_even before you were born./Israel, don’t be terrified!/You are my chosen servant,/_my very favorite.

18537.text: ¶I will bless the thirsty land/_by sending streams of water;/I will bless your descendants/_by giving them my Spirit.

18538.text: /They will spring up like grass/or like willow trees/_near flowing streams.

18539.text: /They will worship me/_and become my people./They will write my name/_on the back of their hands.

18540.text: ¶I am the Lord All‐Powerful,/the first and the last,/_the one and only God./Israel, I have rescued you!/_I am your King.

18541.text: /Can anyone compare with me?/If so, let them speak up/_and tell me now./Let them say what has happened/since I made my nation/_long ago,/and let them tell/_what is going to happen.

18542.text: /Don’t tremble with fear!/Didn’t I tell you long ago?/_Didn’t you hear me?/I alone am God—/no one else is a mighty rock.

18543.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼Those people who make idols/_are nothing themselves,/and the idols they treasure/_are just as worthless./Worshipers of idols are blind,/_stupid, and foolish.

18544.text: /Why make an idol or an image/_that can’t do a thing?

18545.text: /Everyone who makes idols/and all who worship them/_are mere humans,/who will end up/_sadly disappointed./Let them face me in court/_and be terrified.

18546.text: §¶A metalworker shapes an idol/by using a hammer/_and heat from the fire./In his powerful hand/_he holds a hammer,/as he pounds the metal/_into the proper shape./But he gets hungry and thirsty/_and loses his strength.

18547.text: ¶Some woodcarver measures/a piece of wood,/_then draws an outline./The idol is carefully carved/_with each detail exact./At last it looks like a person/_and is placed in a temple.

18548.text: /Either cedar, cypress, oak,/or any tree from the forest/_may be chosen./Or even a pine tree planted/by the woodcarver/_and watered by the rain.

18549.text: ¶Some of the wood is used/to make a fire for heating/_or for cooking./One piece is made into an idol,/then the woodcarver bows down/_and worships it.

18550.text: /He enjoys the warm fire/and the meat that was roasted/_over the burning coals.

18551.text: /Afterwards, he bows down/_to worship the wooden idol./“Protect me!” he says./_“You are my god.”

18552.text: ¶Those who worship idols are stupid and blind!

18553.text: They don’t have enough sense to say to themselves, “I made a fire with half of the wood and cooked my bread and meat on it. Then I made something worthless with the other half. Why worship a block of wood?”

18554.text: ¶How can anyone be stupid enough to trust something that can be burned to ashes? No one can save themselves like that. Don’t they realize that the idols they hold in their hands are not really gods?

18555.text: §¶People of Israel,/you are my servant,/_so remember all of this./Israel, I created you,/and you are my servant./_I won’t forget you.

18556.text: /Turn back to me!/_I have rescued you/and swept away your sins/_as though they were clouds.

18557.text: §¶Tell the heavens and the earth/_to start singing!/Tell the mountains/and every tree in the forest/_to join in the song!/The Lord has rescued his people;/_now they will worship him.

18558.text: §¶Israel, I am your Lord./I am your source of life,/_and I have rescued you./I created everything/from the sky above/_to the earth below.

18559.text: ¶I make liars of false prophets/_and fools of fortunetellers./I take human wisdom/_and turn it into nonsense.

18560.text: /I will make the message/_of my prophets come true./They are saying, “Jerusalem/_will be filled with people,/and the Lord will rebuild/_the towns of Judah.”

18561.text: ¶I am the one who commands/the sea and its streams/_to run dry.

18562.text: /I am also the one who says,/“Cyrus will lead my people/_and obey my orders./Jerusalem and the temple/_will be rebuilt.”

18563.text: §¶The Lord said to Cyrus, his chosen one:¶▼I have taken hold/_of your right hand/to help you capture nations/_and remove kings from power./City gates will open for you;/_not one will stay closed.

18564.text: /As I lead you,/_I will level mountains/and break the iron bars/_on bronze gates of cities.

18565.text: ¶I will give you treasures/hidden in dark/_and secret places./Then you will know that I,/the Lord God of Israel,/_have called you by name.

18566.text: /Cyrus, you don’t even know me!/But I have called you by name/_and highly honored you/because of Israel,/_my chosen servant.

18567.text: ¶Only I am the Lord!/_There are no other gods./I have made you strong,/_though you don’t know me.

18568.text: /Now everyone from east to west/will learn that I am the Lord./_No other gods are real.

18569.text: /I create light and darkness,/happiness and sorrow./_I, the Lord, do all of this.

18570.text: ¶Tell the heavens/to send down justice/_like showers of rain./Prepare the earth/_for my saving power/to sprout/and produce justice/_that I, the Lord, create.

18571.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼Israel, you have no right/_to argue with your Creator./You are merely a clay pot/_shaped by a potter./The clay doesn’t ask,/“Why did you make me this way?/_Where are the handles?”

18572.text: /Children don’t have the right/_to demand of their parents,/“What have you done/_to make us what we are?”

18573.text: ¶I am the Lord, the Creator,/_the holy God of Israel./Do you dare question me/about my own nation/_or about what I have done?

18574.text: /I created the world/_and covered it with people;/I stretched out the sky/_and filled it with stars.

18575.text: /I have done the right thing/_by placing Cyrus in power,/and I will make the roads easy/_for him to follow./I am the Lord All‐Powerful!/_Cyrus will rebuild my city/_and set my people free/_without being paid a thing./I, the Lord, have spoken.

18576.text: §¶My people, I, the Lord, promise/_that the riches of Egypt/and the treasures of Ethiopia/_will belong to you./You will force into slavery/_those tall people of Seba.¶They will bow down and say,/“The only true God is with you;/_there are no other gods.”

18577.text: /People of Israel,/your God is a mystery,/_though he alone can save.

18578.text: /Anyone who makes idols/will be confused/_and terribly disgraced.

18579.text: /But Israel, I, the Lord,/will always keep you safe/_and free from shame.

18580.text: §¶The Lord alone is God!/He created the heavens/_and made a world/where people can live,/instead of creating/_an empty desert./The Lord alone is God;/_there are no others.

18581.text: /The Lord did not speak/_in a dark secret place/or command Jacob’s descendants/_to search for him in vain.¶The Lord speaks the truth,/_and this is what he says

18582.text: /to every survivor/_from every nation:/“Gather around me!/Learn how senseless it is/_to worship wooden idols/_or pray to helpless gods.

18583.text: ¶“Why don’t you get together/_and meet me in court?/Didn’t I tell you long ago/_what would happen?/I am the only God!/_There are no others./I bring about justice,/_and have the power to save.

18584.text: ¶“I invite the whole world/_to turn to me and be saved./I alone am God!/_No others are real.

18585.text: /I have made a solemn promise,/_one that won’t be broken:/Everyone will bow down/_and worship me.

18586.text: /They will admit that I alone/_can bring about justice./Everyone who is angry with me/will be terribly ashamed/_and will turn to me.

18587.text: /I, the Lord, will give/victory and great honor/_to the people of Israel.”

18588.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼The gods Bel and Nebo/_are down on their knees,/as wooden images of them/are carried away/_on weary animals.

18589.text: /They are down on their knees/_to rescue the heavy load,/but the images are still taken/_to a foreign country.

18590.text: ¶You survivors in Israel,/_listen to me, the Lord./Since the day you were born,/_I have carried you along.

18591.text: /I will still be the same/when you are old and gray,/_and I will take care of you./I created you. I will carry you/_and always keep you safe.

18592.text: ¶Can anyone compare with me?/_Is anyone my equal?

18593.text: /Some people hire a goldsmith/_and give silver and gold/to be formed into an idol/_for them to worship.

18594.text: /They carry the idol/_on their shoulders,/then put it on a stand,/_but it cannot move.¶They call out to the idol/_when they are in trouble,/but it doesn’t answer,/_and it cannot help.

18595.text: /Now keep this in mind,/you sinful people./_And don’t ever forget it.

18596.text: §¶I alone am God!/There are no other gods;/_no one is like me./Think about what happened/_many years ago.

18597.text: /From the very beginning,/I told what would happen/_long before it took place.¶I kept my word

18598.text: /and brought/someone from a distant land/_to do what I wanted./He attacked from the east,/_like a hawk swooping down./Now I will keep my promise/_and do what I planned.

18599.text: ¶You people are stubborn/and far from being safe,/_so listen to me.

18600.text: /I will soon come to save you./I am not far away/_and will waste no time;/I take pride in Israel/_and will save Jerusalem.

18601.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼City of Babylon,/You are delicate/_and untouched,/_but that will change./Surrender your royal power/_and sit in the dirt.

18602.text: /Start grinding grain!/_Take off your veil./Strip off your fancy clothes/_and cross over rivers.

18603.text: /You will suffer the shame/_of going naked,/because I will take revenge,/_and no one can escape.

18604.text: /I am the Lord All‐Powerful,/the holy God of Israel./_I am their Savior.

18605.text: ¶Babylon, be silent!/_Sit in the dark./No longer will nations/_accept you as their queen.

18606.text: /I was angry with my people./So I let you take their land/_and bring disgrace on them./You showed them no mercy,/but were especially cruel/_to those who were old.

18607.text: /You thought that you/_would be queen forever./You didn’t care what you did;/it never entered your mind/_that you might get caught.

18608.text: ¶You think that you alone/_are all‐powerful,/that you won’t be a widow/_or lose your children./All you care about is pleasure,/_but listen to what I say.

18609.text: /Your magic powers and charms/_will suddenly fail,/then you will be a widow/_and lose your children.

18610.text: ¶You hid behind evil/like a shield and said,/_“No one can see me!”/You were fooled by your wisdom/_and your knowledge;/you felt sure that you alone/_were in full control.

18611.text: /But without warning,/_disaster will strike—/and your magic charms/_won’t help at all.

18612.text: ¶Keep using your magic powers/and your charms/_as you have always done./Maybe—just maybe—/_you will frighten somebody!

18613.text: /You have worn yourself out,/_asking for advice/from those who study the stars/and tell the future/_month after month./Go ask them how to be saved/_from what will happen.

18614.text: /People who trust the stars/are as helpless/as straw/_in a flaming fire./No one can even keep warm,/sitting by a fire/_that feeds only on straw.

18615.text: /These are the fortunetellers/you have done business with/_all of your life./But they don’t know/where they are going,/_and they can’t save you.

18616.text: §¶People of Israel,/you come from Jacob’s family/_and the tribe of Judah./You claim to worship me,/the Lord God of Israel,/_but you are lying.

18617.text: /You call Jerusalem your home/_and say you depend on me,/the Lord All‐Powerful,/_the God of Israel.

18618.text: ¶Long ago I announced/_what was going to be,/then without warning,/_I made it happen.

18620.text: /And I told you these things,/so that when they happened/_you would not say,/“The idols we worship did this.”

18621.text: ¶You heard what I said,/and you have seen it happen./_Now admit that it’s true!/I will show you secrets/_you have never known.

18622.text: /Today I am doing something new,/something you cannot say/_you have heard before.

18623.text: /You have never been willing/_to listen to what I say;/from the moment of your birth,/_I knew you would rebel.

18624.text: §¶I, the Lord, am true to myself;/I will be praised/for not punishing/_and destroying you.

18625.text: /I tested you in hard times/just as silver is refined/_in a heated furnace.

18626.text: /I did this because of who I am./I refuse to be dishonored/_or share my praise/_with any other god.

18627.text: ¶Israel, my chosen people,/_listen to me./I alone am the Lord,/_the first and the last.

18628.text: /With my own hand/I created the earth/_and stretched out the sky./They obey my every command.

18629.text: §¶Gather around me, all of you!/_Listen to what I say./Did any of your idols/_predict this would happen?/Did they say that my friend/would do/what I want done/_to Babylonia?

18630.text: /I was the one who chose him./I have brought him this far,/_and he will be successful.

18631.text: /Come closer and listen!/I have never kept secret/_the things I have said,/and I was here/_before time began.§¶By the power of his Spirit/the Lord God has sent me

18632.text: /_with this message:/People of Israel,/I am the holy Lord God,/_the one who rescues you./For your own good,/I teach you,/and I lead you/_along the right path.

18633.text: /How I wish that you/_had obeyed my commands!/Your success and good fortune/would then have overflowed/_like a flooding river.

18634.text: /Your nation would be blessed/_with more people/than there are grains of sand/_along the seashore./And I would never have let/_your country be destroyed.

18635.text: ¶Now leave Babylon!/_Celebrate as you go./Be happy and shout/_for everyone to hear,/“The Lord has rescued/_his servant Israel!

18636.text: /He led us through the desert/and made water flow from a rock/_to satisfy our thirst.

18637.text: /But the Lord has promised/that none who are evil/_will live in peace.”

18638.text: §¶Everyone, listen,/even you foreign nations/_across the sea./The Lord chose me/and gave me a name/_before I was born.

18639.text: /He made my words pierce/like a sharp sword/_or a pointed arrow;/he kept me safely hidden/_in the palm of his hand.

18640.text: /The Lord said to me,/_“Israel, you are my servant;/and because of you/_I will be highly honored.”

18641.text: ¶I said to myself,/“I’m completely worn out;/_my time has been wasted./But I did it for the Lord God,/_and he will reward me.”

18642.text: ¶Even before I was born,/_the Lord God chose me/to serve him and to lead back/_the people of Israel./So the Lord has honored me/_and made me strong.

18643.text: ¶Now the Lord says to me,/“It isn’t enough for you/_to be merely my servant./You must do more than lead back/survivors/from the tribes/_of Israel./I have placed you here as a light/_for other nations;/you must take my saving power/_to everyone on earth.”

18644.text: §¶Israel, I am the holy Lord God,/_the one who rescues you./You are slaves of rulers/and of a nation/_who despises you./Now this is what I promise:/Kings and rulers will honor you/_by kneeling at your feet./You can trust me! I am your Lord,/the holy God of Israel,/_and you are my chosen ones.

18645.text: §¶This is what the Lord says:/_I will answer your prayers/because I have set a time/when I will help/_by coming to save you./I have chosen you/to take my promise of hope/_to other nations./You will rebuild the country/_from its ruins,/then people will come/_and settle there.

18646.text: /You will set prisoners free/from dark dungeons/_to see the light of day.¶On their way home,/they will find plenty to eat,/_even on barren hills.

18647.text: /They won’t go hungry/_or get thirsty;/they won’t be bothered/by the scorching sun/_or hot desert winds./I will be merciful/while leading them along/_to streams of water.

18648.text: /I will level the mountains/_and make roads.

18649.text: /Then my people will return/_from distant lands/in the north and the west/_and from the city of Syene.

18650.text: §¶Tell the heavens and the earth/_to celebrate and sing;/command every mountain/_to join in the song./The Lord’s people have suffered,/but he has shown mercy/_and given them comfort.

18651.text: ¶The people of Zion said,/“The Lord has turned away/_and forgotten us.”

18652.text: ¶The Lord answered,/“Could a mother forget a child/_who nurses at her breast?/Could she fail to love an infant/_who came from her own body?/Even if a mother could forget,/_I will never forget you.

18653.text: /A picture of your city/_is drawn on my hand./You are always in my thoughts!

18654.text: ¶“Your city will be built faster/_than it was destroyed—/those who attacked it/_will retreat and leave.

18655.text: /Look around! You will see/_your people coming home./As surely as I live,/_I, the Lord, promise/that your city with its people/will be as lovely as a bride/_wearing her jewelry.”

18656.text: §¶Jerusalem is now in ruins!/_Nothing is left of the city./But it will be rebuilt/_and soon overcrowded;/its cruel enemies/_will be gone far away.

18657.text: ¶Jerusalem is a woman/_whose children were born/while she was in deep sorrow/_over the loss of her husband./Now those children/will come and seek room/_in the crowded city,

18658.text: /and Jerusalem will ask,/_“Am I really their mother?/How could I have given birth/when I was still mourning/_in a foreign land?/Who raised these children?/Where have they come from?”

18659.text: ¶The Lord God says:/“I will soon give a signal/_for the nations/to return your sons/and your daughters/_to the arms of Jerusalem.

18660.text: /The kings and queens/_of those nations/where they were raised/_will come and bow down./They will take care of you/just like a slave/_taking care of a child./Then you will know/_that I am the Lord./You won’t be disappointed/_if you trust me.”

18661.text: §¶Is it possible to rescue victims/from someone strong/_and cruel?

18662.text: /But the Lord has promised/_to fight on our side/and to rescue our children/from those strong/_and violent enemies.

18663.text: /He will make those cruel people/_dine on their own flesh/and get drunk from drinking/_their own blood./Then everyone will know/_that the Lord is our Savior;/the powerful God of Israel/_has rescued his people.

18664.text: §¶The Lord says, “Children,/I didn’t divorce your mother/_or sell you to pay debts;/I divorced her and sold you/_because of your sins.

18665.text: /I came and called out,/_but you didn’t answer./Have I lost my power/_to rescue and save?/At my command oceans and rivers/_turn into deserts;/fish rot and stink/_for lack of water.

18666.text: /I make the sky turn dark/like the sackcloth/_you wear at funerals.”

18667.text: §¶The Lord God gives me/the right words/_to encourage the weary./Each morning he awakens me/_eager to learn his teaching;

18668.text: /he made me willing to listen/_and not rebel or run away.

18669.text: ¶I let them beat my back/_and pull out my beard./I didn’t turn aside/when they insulted me/_and spit in my face.

18670.text: /But the Lord God keeps me/_from being disgraced./So I refuse to give up,/because I know/_God will never let me down.

18671.text: ¶My protector is nearby;/no one can stand here/_to accuse me of wrong.

18672.text: /The Lord God will help me/_and prove I am innocent./My accusers will wear out/_like moth‐eaten clothes.

18673.text: ¶None of you respect the Lord/_or obey his servant./You walk in the dark/_instead of the light;/you don’t trust the name/_of the Lord your God.

18674.text: /Go ahead and walk in the light/_of the fires you have set./But with his own hand,/the Lord will punish you/_and make you suffer.

18675.text: §¶If you want to do right/and obey the Lord,/_follow Abraham’s example./He was the rock from which/_you were chipped.

18676.text: /God chose Abraham and Sarah/_to be your ancestors./The Lord blessed Abraham,/and from that one man/_came many descendants.

18677.text: ¶Though Zion is in ruins,/_the Lord will bring comfort,/and the city will be as lovely/as the garden of Eden/_that he provided./Then Zion will celebrate;/it will be thankful/_and sing joyful songs.

18678.text: §¶The Lord says:/You are my people and nation!/_So pay attention to me./My teaching will cause justice/to shine like a light/_for every nation.

18679.text: /Those who live across the sea/are eagerly waiting/_for me to rescue them./I am strong and ready;/soon I will come to save/_and to rule all nations.

18680.text: ¶Look closely at the sky!/_Stare at the earth./The sky will vanish like smoke;/the earth will wear out/_like clothes./Everyone on this earth/_will die like flies./But my victory will last;/my saving power never ends.

18681.text: ¶If you want to do right/_and to obey my teaching/with all your heart,/_then pay close attention./Don’t be discouraged/when others insult you/_and say hurtful things.

18682.text: /They will be eaten away/_like a moth‐eaten coat./But my victory will last;/my saving power/_will never end.

18683.text: §¶Wake up! Do something, Lord./_Be strong and ready./Wake up! Do what you did/_for our people long ago./Didn’t you chop up/_Rahab the monster?

18684.text: /Didn’t you dry up the deep sea/and make a road/for your people/_to follow safely across?

18685.text: /Now those you have rescued/will return to Jerusalem,/_singing on their way./They will be crowned/_with great happiness,/never again to be burdened/_with sadness and sorrow.

18686.text: §¶I am the Lord, the one/_who encourages you./Why are you afraid/_of mere humans?/They dry up and die like grass.

18687.text: ¶I spread out the heavens/and laid foundations/_for the earth./But you have forgotten me,/_your Lord and Creator./All day long you were afraid/of those who were angry/_and hoped to abuse you./Where are they now?

18688.text: ¶Everyone crying out in pain/_will be quickly set free;/they will be rescued/from the power of death/_and never go hungry.

18689.text: /I will help them/_because I am your God,/the Lord All‐Powerful,/_who makes the ocean roar.

18690.text: ¶I have told you what to say,/and I will keep you safe/_in the palm of my hand./I spread out the heavens/and laid foundations/_for the earth./Now I say, “Jerusalem,/_your people are mine.”

18691.text: §¶Jerusalem, wake up! Stand up!/You’ve drunk too much/_from the cup filled/_with the Lord’s anger./You have swallowed every drop,/_and you can’t walk straight.

18692.text: /Not one of your many children/is there to guide you/_or to offer a helping hand.

18693.text: /You have been destroyed/by war and by famine;/_I cannot comfort you.

18694.text: /The Lord your God is angry,/_and on every street corner/your children lie helpless,/_like deer trapped in nets.

18695.text: ¶You are in trouble and drunk,/_but not from wine./So pay close attention

18696.text: /to the Lord your God,/_who defends you and says,/“I have taken from your hands/the cup filled with my anger/_that made you drunk./You will never be forced/_to drink it again.

18697.text: /Instead I will give it/_to your brutal enemies,/who treated you like dirt/_and walked all over you.”

18698.text: §¶Jerusalem, wake up!/_Stand up and be strong./Holy city of Zion,/_dress in your best clothes./Those foreigners who ruined/your sacred city/_won’t bother you again.

18699.text: /Zion, rise from the dirt!/Free yourself from the rope/_around your neck.

18700.text: §¶The Lord says:/My people, you were sold,/_but not for money;/now you will be set free,/_but not for a payment.

18701.text: /Long ago you went to Egypt/where you lived/_as foreigners./Then Assyria was cruel to you,

18702.text: /_and now another nation/has taken you prisoner/_for no reason at all./Your leaders groan with pain,/and day after day/_my own name is cursed.

18703.text: /My people, you will learn/who I am and who is speaking/_because I am here.

18704.text: §¶What a beautiful sight!/On the mountains a messenger/_announces to Jerusalem,/“Good news! You’re saved./There will be peace./_Your God is now King.”

18705.text: /Everyone on guard duty,/_sing and celebrate!/Look! You can see the Lord/_returning to Zion.

18706.text: /Jerusalem, rise from the ruins!/_Join in the singing./The Lord has given comfort/to his people;/_he comes to your rescue.

18707.text: /The Lord has shown all nations/_his mighty strength;/now everyone will see/_the saving power of our God.

18708.text: §¶Leave the city of Babylon!/_Don’t touch anything filthy./Wash yourselves. Be ready/to carry back everything sacred/_that belongs to the Lord.

18709.text: /You won’t need to run./_No one is chasing you./The Lord God of Israel/will lead and protect you/_from enemy attacks.

18710.text: §¶The Lord says:/_My servant will succeed!/He will be given great praise/_and the highest honors.

18711.text: /Many were horrified/_at what happened to him./But everyone who saw him/_was even more horrified/because he suffered until/_he no longer looked human.

18712.text: /My servant will make/nations worthy to worship me;/_kings will be silent/_as they bow in wonder./They will see and think about/things/they have never seen/_or thought about before.

18713.text: §¶Has anyone believed us/or seen the mighty power/_of the Lord in action?

18714.text: /Like a young plant or a root/_that sprouts in dry ground,/the servant grew up/_obeying the Lord./He wasn’t some handsome king./Nothing about the way he looked/_made him attractive to us.

18715.text: /He was hated and rejected;/his life was filled with sorrow/_and terrible suffering./No one wanted to look at him./We despised him and said,/_“He is a nobody!”

18716.text: ¶He suffered and endured/_great pain for us,/but we thought his suffering/_was punishment from God.

18717.text: /He was wounded and crushed/_because of our sins;/by taking our punishment,/_he made us completely well.

18718.text: /All of us were like sheep/_that had wandered off./We had each gone our own way,/but the Lord gave him/_the punishment we deserved.

18719.text: ¶He was painfully abused,/_but he did not complain./He was silent like a lamb/_being led to the butcher,/as quiet as a sheep/_having its wool cut off.

18720.text: ¶He was condemned to death/_without a fair trial./Who could have imagined/_what would happen to him?/His life was taken away/because of the sinful things/_my people had done.

18721.text: /He wasn’t dishonest or violent,/but he was buried in a tomb/_of cruel and rich people.

18722.text: ¶The Lord decided his servant/_would suffer as a sacrifice/to take away the sin/_and guilt of others./Now the servant will live/_to see his own descendants./He did everything/_the Lord had planned.

18723.text: ¶By suffering, the servant/will learn the true meaning/_of obeying the Lord./Although he is innocent,/he will take the punishment/_for the sins of others,/so that many of them/_will no longer be guilty.

18724.text: /The Lord will reward him/with honor and power/_for sacrificing his life./Others thought he was a sinner,/but he suffered for our sins/_and asked God to forgive us.

18725.text: §¶Sing and shout,/even though you have never/_had children!/The Lord has promised that you/_will have more children/than someone married/_for a long time.

18726.text: /Make your tents larger!/Spread out the tent pegs;/_fasten them firmly.

18727.text: /You and your descendants/will take over the land/_of other nations./You will settle in towns/_that are now in ruins.

18728.text: ¶Don’t be afraid or ashamed/and don’t be discouraged./_You won’t be disappointed./Forget how sinful you were/_when you were young;/stop feeling ashamed/_for being left a widow.

18729.text: /The Lord All‐Powerful,/the Holy God of Israel,/_rules all the earth./He is your Creator and husband,/_and he will rescue you.

18730.text: ¶You were like a young wife,/_brokenhearted and crying/because her husband/_had divorced her./But the Lord your God says,/_“I am taking you back!

18731.text: /I rejected you for a while,/but with love and tenderness/_I will embrace you again.

18732.text: /For a while, I turned away/_in furious anger./Now I will have mercy/_and love you forever!/I, your protector and Lord,/_make this promise.”

18733.text: §¶I once promised Noah that I/would never again/destroy/_the earth by a flood./Now I have promised that I/will never again/get angry/_and punish you.

18734.text: /Every mountain and hill/_may disappear./But I will always be kind/_and merciful to you;/I won’t break my agreement/_to give your nation peace.

18735.text: §¶Jerusalem, you are sad/and discouraged,/_tossed around in a storm./But I, the Lord,/will rebuild your city/_with precious stones;/for your foundation/_I will use blue sapphires.

18736.text: /Your fortresses/_will be built of rubies,/your gates of jewels,/_and your walls of gems.

18737.text: /I will teach your children/_and make them successful.

18738.text: ¶You will be built on fairness/_with no fears of injustice;/every one of your worries/_will be taken far from you.

18739.text: /I will never send anyone/_to attack your city,/and you will make prisoners/_of those who do attack.

18740.text: /Don’t forget that I created/metalworkers/who make weapons/_over burning coals./I also created armies/_that can bring destruction.

18741.text: /Weapons made to attack you/_won’t be successful;/words spoken against you/_won’t hurt at all.¶My servants, Jerusalem is yours!/I, the Lord, promise/_to bless you with victory.

18742.text: §¶If you are thirsty,/_come and drink water!/If you don’t have any money,/_come, eat what you want!/Drink wine and milk/_without paying a cent.

18743.text: /Why waste your money/_on what really isn’t food?/Why work hard for something/_that doesn’t satisfy?/Listen carefully to me,/and you will enjoy/_the very best foods.

18744.text: ¶Pay close attention!/_Come to me and live./I will promise you/the eternal love and loyalty/_that I promised David.

18745.text: /I made him the leader and ruler/of the nations;/_he was my witness to them.

18746.text: /You will call out to nations/_you have never known./And they have never known you,/but they will come running/_because I am the Lord,/the holy God of Israel,/_and I have honored you.

18747.text: §¶Turn to the Lord!/He can still be found./_Call out to God! He is near.

18748.text: /Give up your crooked ways/_and your evil thoughts./Return to the Lord our God./He will be merciful/_and forgive your sins.

18749.text: ¶The Lord says:/“My thoughts and my ways/_are not like yours.

18750.text: /Just as the heavens/_are higher than the earth,/my thoughts and my ways/_are higher than yours.

18751.text: ¶“Rain and snow fall from the sky./But they don’t return/_without watering the earth/that produces seeds to plant/_and grain to eat.

18752.text: /That’s how it is with my words./_They don’t return to me/without doing everything/_I send them to do.”

18753.text: §¶When you are set free,/you will celebrate/_and travel home in peace./Mountains and hills will sing/as you pass by,/_and trees will clap.

18754.text: /Cypress and myrtle trees/will grow in fields/_once covered by thorns./And then those trees will stand/as a lasting witness/_to the glory of the Lord.

18755.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼Be honest and fair!/Soon I will come to save you;/my saving power will be seen/_everywhere on earth.

18756.text: ¶I will bless everyone/who respects the Sabbath/_and refuses to do wrong.

18757.text: ¶Foreigners who worship me/_must not say,/“The Lord won’t let us/_be part of his people.”/Men who are unable/_to become fathers/must no longer say,/_“We are dried‐up trees.”

18758.text: ¶To them, I, the Lord, say:/_Respect the Sabbath,/_obey me completely,/_and keep our agreement.

18759.text: /Then I will set up monuments/in my temple/with your names/_written on them./This will be much better/_than having children,/because these monuments/_will stand there forever.

18760.text: ¶Foreigners will follow me./They will love me/and worship/_in my name;/they will respect the Sabbath/_and keep our agreement.

18761.text: /I will bring them/_to my holy mountain,/where they will celebrate/_in my house of worship./Their sacrifices and offerings/will always be welcome/_on my altar./Then my house will be known/as a house of worship/_for all nations.

18762.text: /I, the Lord, promise/to bring together my people/_who were taken away,/and let them join the others.

18763.text: §¶Come from the forest,/_you wild animals!/Attack and gobble down/_your victims.

18764.text: /You leaders of Israel/should be watchdogs,/_protecting my people./But you can’t see a thing,/_and you never warn them./Dozing and daydreaming/_are all you ever do.

18765.text: /You stupid leaders are a pack/of hungry and greedy dogs/_that never get enough./You are shepherds/who mistreat your own sheep/_for selfish gain.

18766.text: /You say to each other,/“Let’s drink till we’re drunk!/_Tomorrow we’ll do it again./We’ll really enjoy ourselves.”

18767.text: §¶God’s faithful people/are dragged off and killed,/_and no one even cares./Evil sweeps them away,

18768.text: /but in death they find peace/_for obeying God.

18769.text: §¶You people are unfaithful!/You go to fortunetellers,/_and you worship idols./Now pay close attention!

18770.text: /Who are you making fun of?/_Who are you sneering at?/Look how your sins/_have made fools of you.

18771.text: ¶All you think about is sex/under those green trees/_where idols are worshiped./You sacrifice your children/on altars built in valleys/_under rocky slopes.

18772.text: /You have chosen to worship/_idols made of stone;/you have given them offerings/of wine and grain./_Should I be pleased?

18773.text: ¶You have spread out your beds/on the tops of high mountains,/_where you sacrifice to idols.

18774.text: /Even in your homes/you have placed pagan symbols/_all around your huge beds./Yes, you have rejected me,/sold yourselves to your lovers,/_and gone to bed with them.

18775.text: ¶You smear on olive oil/and all kinds of perfume/_to worship the god Molech./You even seek advice/_from spirits of the dead.

18776.text: /Though you tired yourself out/by running after idols,/_you refused to stop./Your desires were so strong/_that they kept you going.

18777.text: ¶Did you forget about me/_and become unfaithful/because you were more afraid/_of someone else?/Have I been silent so long/_that you no longer fear me?

18778.text: /You think you’re so good,/_but I’ll point out the truth.

18779.text: /Ask your idols to save you/_when you are in trouble./Be careful though—/it takes only a faint breath/_to blow them over./But if you come to me/_for protection,/this land and my holy mountain/_will always belong to you.

18780.text: §¶The Lord says,/“Clear the road!/_Get it ready for my people.”

18781.text: ¶Our holy God lives forever/in the highest heavens,/_and this is what he says:/Though I live high above/_in the holy place,/I am here to help those/who are humble/_and depend only on me.

18782.text: ¶My people, I won’t stay angry/_and keep on accusing you./After all, I am your Creator./I don’t want you to give up/_in complete despair.

18783.text: /Your greed made me furious./That’s why I punished you/_and refused to be found,/while you kept returning/_to your old sinful ways.

18784.text: ¶I know what you are like!/But I will heal you, lead you,/_and give you comfort,/until those who are mourning

18785.text: /_start singing my praises./No matter where you are,/I, the Lord, will heal you/_and give you peace.

18786.text: ¶The wicked are a restless sea/_tossing up mud.

18787.text: /But I, the Lord, have promised/that none who are evil/_will live in peace.

18788.text: §¶Shout the message!/_Don’t hold back./Say to my people Israel:/You’ve sinned! You’ve turned/_against the Lord.

18789.text: /Day after day, you worship him/and seem eager to learn/_his teachings./You act like a nation/that wants to do right/_by obeying his laws./You ask him about justice,/and say you enjoy/_worshiping the Lord.

18790.text: ¶You wonder why the Lord/_pays no attention/when you go without eating/_and act humble./But on those same days/_that you give up eating,/you think only of yourselves/_and abuse your workers.

18791.text: /You even get angry/_and ready to fight./No wonder God won’t listen/_to your prayers!

18792.text: ¶Do you think the Lord/_wants you to give up eating/and to act as humble/_as a bent‐over bush?/Or to dress in sackcloth/_and sit in ashes?/Is this really what he wants/_on a day of worship?

18793.text: ¶I’ll tell you/what it really means/_to worship the Lord./Remove the chains of prisoners/_who are chained unjustly./Free those who are abused!

18794.text: /Share your food with everyone/_who is hungry;/share your home/_with the poor and homeless./Give clothes to those in need;/don’t turn away your relatives.

18795.text: ¶Then your light will shine/like the dawning sun,/and you/_will quickly be healed./Your honesty will protect you/_as you advance,/and the glory of the Lord/_will defend you from behind.

18796.text: /When you beg the Lord for help,/_he will answer, “Here I am!”¶Don’t mistreat others/or falsely accuse them/_or say something cruel.

18797.text: /Give your food to the hungry/_and care for the homeless./Then your light will shine/_in the dark;/your darkest hour will be/_like the noonday sun.

18798.text: ¶The Lord will always guide you/and provide good things to eat/_when you are in the desert./He will make you healthy./You will be like a garden/_that has plenty of water/or like a stream/_that never runs dry.

18799.text: /You will rebuild those houses/_left in ruins for years;/you will be known/as a builder and repairer/_of city walls and streets.

18800.text: ¶But first, you must start/respecting the Sabbath/_as a joyful day of worship./You must stop doing and saying/whatever you please/_on this special day.

18801.text: /Then you will truly enjoy/_knowing the Lord./He will let you rule/_from the highest mountains/and bless you with the land/of your ancestor Jacob./_The Lord has spoken!

18802.text: §¶The Lord hasn’t lost/_his powerful strength;/he can still hear/_and answer prayers.

18803.text: /Your sins are the roadblock/_between you and your God./That’s why he doesn’t answer/your prayers/_or let you see his face.

18804.text: ¶Your talk is filled with lies/_and plans for violence;/every finger on your hands/_is covered with blood.

18805.text: /You falsely accuse others/_and tell lies in court;/sin and trouble are the names/_of your children.

18806.text: /You eat the deadly eggs/_of poisonous snakes,/and more snakes crawl out/_from the eggs left to hatch./You weave spider webs,

18807.text: /but you can’t make clothes/_with those webs/_or hide behind them.¶You’re sinful and brutal.

18808.text: /You hurry off to do wrong/_or murder innocent victims./All you think about is sin;/you leave ruin and destruction/_wherever you go.

18809.text: /You don’t know how/to live in peace/_or to be fair with others./The roads you make are crooked;/your followers cannot find peace.

18810.text: §¶No one has come to defend us/_or to bring about justice./We hoped for a day of sunshine,/but all we found/_was a dark, gloomy night.

18811.text: /We feel our way along,/_as if we were blind;/we stumble at noon,/_as if it were night./We can see no better/_than someone dead.

18812.text: ¶We growl like bears/_and mourn like doves./We hope for justice and victory,/_but they escape us.

18813.text: /How often have we sinned/and turned against you,/_the Lord God?/Our sins condemn us!/_We have done wrong.

18814.text: /We have rebelled and refused/_to follow you./Our hearts were deceitful,/_and so we lied;/we planned to abuse others/_and turn our backs on you.

18815.text: ¶Injustice is everywhere;/_justice seems far away./Truth is chased out of court;/_honesty is shoved aside.

18816.text: /Everyone tells lies;/those who turn from crime/_end up ruined.§¶When the Lord noticed/that justice had disappeared,/_he became very displeased.

18817.text: /It disgusted him even more/to learn/that no one/_would do a thing about it./So with his own powerful arm,/_he won victories for truth.

18818.text: /Justice was the Lord’s armor;/_saving power was his helmet;/anger and revenge/_were his clothes.

18819.text: ¶Now the Lord will get furious/_and do to his enemies,/both near and far,/_what they did to his people.

18820.text: /He will attack like a flood/_in a mighty windstorm./Nations in the west and the east/will then honor and praise/_his wonderful name.

18821.text: /The Lord has promised to rescue/_the city of Zion/and Jacob’s descendants/_who turn from sin.

18822.text: ¶The Lord says: “My people,/I promise to give you my Spirit/_and my message./These will be my gifts to you/_and your families forever./I, the Lord, have spoken.”

18823.text: §¶Jerusalem, stand up! Shine!/_Your new day is dawning./The glory of the Lord/_shines brightly on you.

18824.text: /The earth and its people/_are covered with darkness,/but the glory of the Lord/_is shining upon you.

18825.text: /Nations and kings/will come to the light/_of your dawning day.

18826.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼Open your eyes! Look around!/_Crowds are coming./Your sons are on their way/_from distant lands;/your daughters are being carried/_like little children.

18827.text: /When you see this,/_your faces will glow;/your hearts will pound/_and swell with pride./Treasures from across the sea/and the wealth of nations/_will be brought to you.

18828.text: /Your country will be covered/with caravans/of young camels/_from Midian and Ephah./The people of Sheba/will bring gold and spices/_in praise of me, the Lord.

18829.text: /Every sheep of Kedar/_will come to you;/rams from Nebaioth/_will be yours as well./I will accept them as offerings/_and bring honor to my temple.

18830.text: ¶What is that sailing by/like clouds/_or like doves flying home?

18831.text: /On those distant islands/your people are waiting/_for me, the Lord./Seagoing ships lead the way/to bring them home/_with their silver and gold./I, the holy Lord God of Israel,/do this/to honor your people,/_so they will honor me.

18832.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼Jerusalem, your city walls/_will be rebuilt by foreigners;/their rulers will become/_your slaves./I punished you in my anger;/now I will be kind/_and treat you with mercy.

18833.text: ¶Your gates will be open/_day and night/to let the rulers of nations/lead their people to you/_with all their treasures.

18834.text: /Any nation or kingdom/that refuses to serve you/_will be wiped out.

18835.text: /Wood from Lebanon’s best trees/will be brought to you—/_the pines, the firs,/_and the cypress trees./It will be used in my temple/to make beautiful/the place/_where I rest my feet.

18836.text: ¶The descendants of enemies/who hated and mistreated you/_will kneel at your feet./They will say, “You are Zion,/the city of the Lord,/_the holy God of Israel.”

18837.text: ¶You were hated and deserted,/_rejected by everyone./But I will make you beautiful,/a city to be proud of/_for all time to come.

18838.text: /You will drain the wealth/_of kings and foreign nations./You will know that I,/the mighty Lord God of Israel,/_have saved and rescued you.

18839.text: ¶I will bring bronze and iron/_in place of wood and stone;/in place of bronze and iron,/_I will bring gold and silver./I will appoint peace and justice/_as your rulers and leaders.

18840.text: /Violence, destruction, and ruin/will never again/be heard of/_within your borders./“Victory” will be the name/_you give to your walls;/“Praise” will be the name/_you give to your gates.

18841.text: ¶You won’t need the light/_of the sun or the moon./I, the Lord your God,/will be your eternal light/_and bring you honor.

18842.text: /Your sun will never set/_or your moon go down./I, the Lord, will be/_your everlasting light,/and your days of sorrow/_will come to an end.

18843.text: /Your people will live right/_and always own the land;/they are the trees I planted/_to bring praise to me.

18844.text: /Even the smallest family/_will be a powerful nation./I am the Lord,/and when the time comes,/_I will quickly do all this.

18845.text: §¶The Spirit of the Lord God/_has taken control of me!/The Lord has chosen and sent me/to tell the oppressed/_the good news,/to heal the brokenhearted,/and to announce freedom/_for prisoners and captives.

18846.text: /This is the year/_when the Lord God/will show kindness to us/_and punish our enemies.¶The Lord has sent me/to comfort those who mourn,

18847.text: /_especially in Jerusalem./He sent me to give them flowers/_in place of their sorrow,/olive oil in place of tears,/and joyous praise/_in place of broken hearts./They will be called/_“Trees of Justice,”/planted by the Lord/_to honor his name.

18848.text: /Then they will rebuild cities/that have been in ruins/_for many generations.

18849.text: ¶They will hire foreigners/to take care of their sheep/_and their vineyards.

18850.text: /But they themselves will be/priests and servants/_of the Lord our God./The treasures of the nations/will belong to them,/_and they will be famous.

18851.text: /They were terribly insulted/_and horribly mistreated;/now they will be greatly blessed/_and joyful forever.

18852.text: §¶I, the Lord, love justice!/But I hate robbery/_and injustice./My people, I solemnly promise/to reward you/_with an eternal agreement.

18853.text: /Your descendants will be known/_in every nation./All who see them will realize/that they have been blessed,/_by me, the Lord.

18854.text: §¶I celebrate and shout/_because of my Lord God./His saving power and justice/_are the very clothes I wear./They are more beautiful/than the jewelry worn/_by a bride or a groom.

18855.text: /The Lord will bring about/justice and praise/_in every nation on earth,/like flowers blooming/_in a garden.

18856.text: §¶Jerusalem, I will speak up/_for your good./I will never be silent/till you are safe and secure,/_sparkling like a flame.

18857.text: /Your great victory will be seen/_by every nation and king;/the Lord will even give you/_a new name.
