18858.text: /You will be a glorious crown,/a royal headband,/_for the Lord your God.

18859.text: ¶Your name will no longer be/“Deserted and Childless,”/_but “Happily Married.”/You will please the Lord;/your country/_will be his bride.

18860.text: /Your people will take the land,/just as a young man/_takes a bride./The Lord will be pleased/_because of you,/just as a husband is pleased/_with his bride.

18861.text: ¶Jerusalem, on your walls/I have stationed guards,/_whose duty it is/to speak out day and night,/_without resting./They must remind the Lord

18862.text: /_and not let him rest/till he makes Jerusalem strong/_and famous everywhere.

18863.text: ¶The Lord has given his word/_and made this promise:/“Never again will I give/_to your enemies/the grain and grapes/_for which you struggled.

18864.text: /As surely as you harvest/_your grain and grapes,/you will eat your bread/_with thankful hearts,/and you will drink your wine/_in my temple.”

18865.text: ¶People of Jerusalem,/_open your gates!/Repair the road to the city/_and clear it of stones;/raise a banner to help/_the nations find their way.

18866.text: /Here is what the Lord has said/_for all the earth to hear:/“Soon I will come to save/the city of Zion,/_and to reward you.

18867.text: /Then you will be called,/‘The Lord’s Own People,/_The Ones He Rescued!’/Your city will be known/as a good place to live/_and a city full of people.”

18868.text: §¶Who is this coming/from Bozrah in Edom/_with clothes stained red?/Who is this hero marching/_in his glorious uniform?¶“It’s me, the Lord!/I have won the battle,/_and I can save you!”

18869.text: ¶What are those red spots?/Your clothes look stained/_from stomping on grapes.

18870.text: ¶“I alone stomped the grapes!/_None of the nations helped./I stomped nations in my anger/and stained my clothes/_with their blood.

18871.text: /I did this because I wanted/_to take revenge—/the time had come/_to rescue my people.

18872.text: /No one was there to help me/_or to give support;/my mighty arm won the battle,/_strengthened by my anger.

18873.text: /In my fury I stomped on nations/_and made them drunk;/their blood poured out/_everywhere on earth.”

18874.text: §¶I will tell about the kind deeds/the Lord has done./_They deserve praise!/The Lord has shown mercy/to the people of Israel;/_he has been kind and good.

18875.text: ¶The Lord rescued his people,/and said,/“They are mine./_They won’t betray me.”

18876.text: /It troubled the Lord/to see them in trouble,/_and his angel saved them./The Lord was truly merciful,/_so he rescued his people./He took them in his arms/and carried them all those years.

18877.text: ¶Then the Lord’s people/turned against him/and made/_his Holy Spirit sad./So he became their enemy/_and attacked them.

18878.text: /But his people remembered/what had happened/_during the time of Moses./Didn’t the Lord bring them/and their leaders/_safely through the sea?/Didn’t he give them/_his Holy Spirit?

18879.text: /The glorious power of the Lord/_marched beside Moses./The Lord will be praised forever/_for dividing the sea.

18880.text: /He led his people across/like horses running wild/_without stumbling.

18881.text: /His Spirit gave them rest,/just as cattle find rest/_when led into a valley./The name of the Lord was praised/_for doing these things.

18882.text: §¶Please, Lord, look down/_from your holy and glorious/home in the heavens/_and see what’s going on./Have you lost interest?/_Where is your power?/Show that you care about us/_and have mercy!

18883.text: /Our ancestors Abraham and Jacob/_have both rejected us./But you are still our Father;/you have been our protector/_since ancient times.

18884.text: ¶Why did you make us turn away/_from you, our Lord?/Why did you make us want/_to disobey you?/Please change your mind!/We are your servants,/_your very own people.

18885.text: /For a little while,/_your temple belonged to us;/and now our enemies/_have torn it down.

18886.text: /We act as though you/had never ruled us/_or called us your people.

18887.text: /Rip the heavens apart!/Come down, Lord;/_make the mountains tremble.

18888.text: /Be a spark that starts a fire/_causing water to boil./Then your enemies will know/_who you are;/all nations will tremble/_because you are nearby.

18889.text: ¶Your fearsome deeds/_have completely amazed us;/even the mountains shake/_when you come down.

18890.text: /You are the only God/_ever seen or heard of/who works miracles/_for his followers.

18891.text: ¶You help all who gladly obey/and do what you want,/_but sin makes you angry./Only by your help/_can we ever be saved.

18892.text: /We are unfit to worship you;/each of our good deeds/_is merely a filthy rag./We dry up like leaves;/our sins are storm winds/_sweeping us away.

18893.text: /No one worships in your name/_or remains faithful./You have turned your back on us/and let our sins melt us away.

18894.text: ¶You, Lord, are our Father./_We are nothing but clay,/but you are the potter/_who molded us.

18895.text: /Don’t be so furious/or keep our sins/_in your thoughts forever!/Remember that all of us/_are your people.

18896.text: /Every one of your towns/has turned into a desert,/_especially Jerusalem.

18897.text: /Zion’s glorious and holy temple/where our ancestors praised you/_has been destroyed by fire./Our beautiful buildings/_are now a pile of ruins.

18898.text: /When you see these things,/how can you just sit there/_and make us suffer more?

18899.text: §¶I, the Lord, was ready/answer even those/_who were not asking/and to be found by those/_who were not searching./To a nation that refused/to worship me,/_I said, “Here I am!”

18900.text: ¶All day long I have reached out/to stubborn and sinful people/_going their own way.

18901.text: /They keep making me angry/_by sneering at me,/while offering sacrifices/_to idols in gardens/and burning incense/_to them on bricks.

18902.text: /They spend their nights/_hiding in burial caves;/they eat the meat of pigs,/cooked in sauces/_made of stuff unfit to eat.

18903.text: /And then they say to others,/“Don’t come near us!/_We’re dedicated to God.”/Such people are like smoke,/_irritating my nose all day.

18904.text: /I have written this down;/_I won’t keep silent./I’ll pay them back/_just as their sins deserve.

18905.text: /I, the Lord, will make them pay/for their sins/and for those/_of their ancestors—/they have disgraced me/by burning incense/_on mountains.

18906.text: ¶Here is what the Lord says:/_A cluster of grapes/_that produces wine/_is worth keeping!/So, because of my servants,/_I won’t destroy everyone.

18907.text: /I have chosen the people/_of Israel and Judah,/and I will bless them/_with many descendants./They will settle here/in this land of mountains,/_and it will be theirs.

18908.text: /My people will worship me./Then the coastlands of Sharon/_and the land as far/_as Achor Valley/will turn into pastureland/where cattle and sheep/_will feed and rest.

18909.text: ¶What will I, the Lord, do/if any of you reject me/_and my holy mountain?/What will happen to you/_for offering food and wine/to the gods you call/_“Good Luck” and “Fate”?

18910.text: /Your luck will end!/I will see to it/that you/_are slaughtered with swords./You refused to answer/_when I called out;/you paid no attention/_to my instructions./Instead, you did what I hated,/_knowing it was wrong.

18911.text: ¶I, the Lord God, will give/food and drink/to my servants,/_and they will celebrate./But all of you sinners/will go hungry and thirsty,/_overcome with disgrace.

18912.text: /My servants will laugh and sing,/but you will be sad/_and cry out in pain.

18913.text: /I, the Lord God, promise/_to see that you are killed/and that my chosen servants use/_your names/as curse words./But I will give new names/_to my servants.

18914.text: /I am God! I can be trusted./Your past troubles are gone;/_I no longer think of them./When you pray for someone/_to receive a blessing,/or when you make a promise,/_you must do it in my name./I alone am the God/_who can be trusted.

18915.text: §¶I am creating new heavens/_and a new earth;/everything of the past/_will be forgotten.

18916.text: /Celebrate and be glad forever!/I am creating a Jerusalem,/_full of happy people.

18917.text: /I will celebrate with Jerusalem/_and all of its people;/there will be no more crying/_or sorrow in that city.

18918.text: ¶No child will die in infancy;/everyone will live/_to a ripe old age./Anyone a hundred years old/_will be considered young,/and to die younger than that/_will be considered a curse.

18919.text: ¶My people will live/_in the houses they build;/they will enjoy grapes/_from their own vineyards.

18920.text: /No one will take away/_their homes or vineyards./My chosen people will live/_to be as old as trees,/and they will enjoy/_what they have earned.

18921.text: /Their work won’t be wasted,/and their children won’t die/_of dreadful diseases./I will bless their children/_and their grandchildren.

18922.text: /I will answer their prayers/_before they finish praying.

18923.text: ¶Wolves and lambs/_will graze together;/lions and oxen/_will feed on straw./Snakes will eat only dirt!/They won’t bite/or harm anyone/_on my holy mountain./I, the Lord, have spoken!

18924.text: §¶The Lord said:¶▼Heaven is my throne;/_the earth is my footstool./What kind of house/could you build for me?/_In what place will I rest?

18925.text: /I have made everything;/that’s how it all came to be./_I, the Lord, have spoken.¶The people I treasure most/_are the humble—/they depend only on me/_and tremble when I speak.

18926.text: ¶You sacrifice oxen to me,/_and you commit murder;/you sacrifice lambs to me/_and dogs to other gods;/you offer grain to me/_and pigs’ blood to idols;/you burn incense to me/_and praise your idols./You have made your own choice/to do these disgusting things/_that you enjoy so much.

18927.text: /You refused to answer/_when I called out;/you paid no attention/_to my instructions./Instead, you did what I hated,/_knowing it was wrong./Now I will punish you/_in a way you dread the most.

18928.text: §¶If you tremble/when the Lord speaks,/_listen to what he says:/“Some of your own people hate/and reject you because of me./_They make fun and say,/‘Let the Lord show his power!/Let us see him/_make you truly happy.’/But those who say these things/_will be terribly ashamed.”

18929.text: ¶Do you hear that noise/in the city and those shouts/_coming from the temple?/It is the Lord shouting/_as he punishes his enemies.

18930.text: ¶Have you ever heard of a woman/who gave birth to a child/_before having labor pains?

18931.text: /Who ever heard of such a thing/_or imagined it could happen?/Can a nation be born in a day/_or come to life in a second?/Jerusalem is like a mother/who gave birth to her children/_as soon as she was in labor.

18932.text: /The Lord is the one/_who makes birth possible./And he will see that Zion/has many more children./_The Lord has spoken.

18933.text: ¶If you love Jerusalem,/_celebrate and shout!/If you were in sorrow/because of the city,/_you can now be glad.

18934.text: /She will nurse and comfort you,/just like your own mother,/_until you are satisfied./You will fully enjoy/_her wonderful glory.

18935.text: ¶The Lord has promised:/_“I will flood Jerusalem/with the wealth of nations/_and make the city prosper./Zion will nurse you at her breast,/carry you in her arms,/_and hold you in her lap.

18936.text: /I will comfort you there/like a mother/_comforting her child.”

18937.text: ¶When you see this happen,/_you will celebrate;/your strength will return/_faster than grass can sprout./Then everyone will know/that the Lord is present/_with his servants,/but he is angry/_with his enemies.

18938.text: /The Lord will come down/like a whirlwind/_with his flaming chariots./He will be terribly furious/and punish his enemies/_with fire.

18939.text: /The Lord’s fiery sword/_will bring justice/everywhere on this earth/_and execute many people.

18940.text: §¶Some of you get yourselves ready and go to a garden to worship a foreign goddess. You eat the meat of pigs, lizards, and mice. But I, the Lord, will destroy you for this.

18941.text: ¶I know everything you do and think! The time has now come to bring together the people of every language and nation and to show them my glory

18942.text: by proving what I can do. I will send the survivors to Tarshish, Pul, Lud, Meshech, Tubal, Javan, and to the distant islands. I will send them to announce my wonderful glory to nations that have never heard about me.

18943.text: ¶They will bring your relatives from the nations as an offering to me, the Lord. They will come on horses, chariots, wagons, mules, and camels to Jerusalem, my holy mountain. It will be like the people of Israel bringing the right offering to my temple.

18944.text: I promise that some of them will be priests and others will be helpers in my temple. I, the Lord, have spoken.

18945.text: ¶I also promise that you will always have descendants and will never be forgotten, just as the new heavens and the new earth that I create will last forever.

18946.text: On the first day of each month and on each Sabbath, everyone will worship me. I, the Lord, have spoken.

18947.text: ¶My people will go out and look at the dead bodies of those who turned against me. The worms there never die, the fire never stops burning, and the sight of those bodies will be disgusting to everyone.
